Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, the sherd shows remains of glue, there was a joining fragment that is lost now. At the lower part of the sherd two lines in hieratic, written in black ink. The first line starts with rnp.t-sp. The surface also shows a white substance on both sides that could either be remains of an original content or a chemical substance used in post excavation treatment. Nile clay, wheel made. The inner surface shows many traces of pitting. Might originate from clearing of salt crust.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
